lGtA5ldFpvGTBTJQJW4LXA.text: I'm probably in here 4 or 5 times a week. Although the menu doesn't change that much, the sandwiches, soups and wraps are all so good that you can eat them hundreds of times before getting bored. The main pull for me, though, is the coffee - just a straight americano with milk. It's the best I've ever had in a chain shop.

mHviD-C88GknhcNtFfRi8Q.text: Pret is a really good place to grab a nice tasting sandwich if your in a rush. Although its linked to Mcdonalds there is no comparison in the taste. Great place.

stKtNwc1_7vrhPl5563oIA.text: Prêt a Manger is a nice café type place which serves nice food at a slightly higher rate. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing and it's a great meet up place for ladies who want to do lunch or a place to grab a quick bite to eat. They take the time and consideration to make sure that their food is of good standard and quality which is why they have such a good reputation. They have a vast selection of coffees and sandwiches which won't disappoint! I recommend them as they cater to many different people and also have a vegetarian menu and a slim menu.

sSLMEPgtMaJNmVLd0ZrTKw.text: Great food for busy on the go grab a bite to eat. A little on the expensive side.

NvEJhXah3tYUeJc2lylCXA.text: This has to be the best sandwich shop on the planet. Pret a manger never fails to dissapoint with its yummy, fresh, and large variety of sandwiches. Whilst it is fairly pricey in comparison it is so much better than McDonalds etc which might be nearby. The BLT is the one to go for though, they make the best ones in the world. Next time you're feeling hungry, don't miss it!

hRsmKW6cu_VzYylR8lIBhQ.text: Loved this place! They had fresh, organic and very delicious food. Was a very good on-the-go type place. I had their sausage breakfast sandwich which was very yum! Also the tuna sandwich was very good also for lunch.

1DGP2Tv-H8RHntkYw0KwpQ.text: I really like Pret, I do, but for a place that obviously tries to cater to diets like gluten and dairy free they should try a bit harder to provide a few more options. A fee months ago they brought out gluten free wraps. I saw them once and only one flavor. Being allergic to onion as well there isn't a lot I can eat out of their salad selection either so I usually end up getting a free range egg and spinach pot. those things are lifesavers. They have recently bought out almond milk drinks - date and cacao and cashew and banana. I was very excited. and then I tasted them. They do not taste good. ..... ugh they're so close but not quite there, so frustrating. .Let me help Pret! Let me help you get this thing right!! Start with labelling items that are gluten free, dairy free etc like you label the vegetarian options. With no ingredients list on the packaging we have no way if knowing the food is safe. I really love Pret and they have so much potential. .. just not quite yet.

W2C2siEP_15HfEiQ7FLXjQ.text: Our favorite spot to eat for a quick, reasonably priced meal. It's also conveniently located near our hotel (The Park Lane) so we've been stopping here for breakfast the last few mornings. We love their croissants and porridge (with sliced banana!) and spend no more than 10 pounds for the two of us. Sometimes we'll buy a couple of their packaged sandwiches (3-4 pounds each) for lunch later. They also have desserts like chocolate mousse, banana cake, lemon cake, etc. These are around 2-3 pounds. All in all, a great variety at great prices! And... they're everywhere!Also, very clean bathrooms located downstairs.

jjr74CDokBVMs53IygbA0A.text: PaM has been my favourite cafeteria in London since I discovered it, whatever the cafeteria. The food is fresh, mixed salads I buy with a little bun are excellent and the fruit salads extra. The service is friendly and most places cozy  - some are much bigger than others and the best (with toilets). Of course, we'd better avoid the rush hour, The ratio quality/price is excellent.

rxoz7-pDsafPs7wpFHF4Pg.text: Tried their new hot piping wraps, but was quite disappointed. I think I prefer EAT to Pret nowadays, with the pies, oats and cupcakes, it's my preferred London eatery.

Kgy0M1bdFVoK99MJfIHwMQ.text: Pret is so convenient, I wish we had something a little closer to it in the US. Everything is consistent in quality , even between locations. Prices are reasonable, I do with the egg sale was a little tastier, but overall everything is great.

YbiBAE8E2AereTEs5Ppovg.text: I can't live without youbest chain coffee hands down! Not cheap on sandwiches but yummy otherwise. I love you for your coffee. And your great staff. Just keep your over prices salads away from me.

0Pw8zG-zyhonpQDNFnkmlQ.text: Pret is reliable and consistent, with great sandwiches which always taste fresh and have quality ingredients. For the indecisive (or the not-very-hungry), Slim Pret is brilliant: buy half a sandwich for half the price, so you can mix and match. Team it with some potato or vegetable crisps, a choice of still and sparkling drinks, and maybe treat yourself to a dessert - fruit, yoghurt, or delicious cakes. Over the years, the Pret range has expanded so there are soups and hot wraps for cold days, as well as pastries and decent coffee for breakfast. Most shops offer an eat-in area, and staff are famously friendly and pleasant. The only downside: sandwiches do run out in the afternoon, so the choice can be limited towards the end of the day.

XxbNZYb2SC0eYI-cMOu-Zw.text: Service in this Pret has often been a bit too slow for my liking and I was a bit outraged to discover they had hiked up the prices of the flavoured water drinks from 90p to £1.25. They were the only thing that was good value in Pret, now everything is overpriced.[ This branch is busy nearly all of the time it seems. But it is quite large and can accomodate a lot of eaters-in, even if the counter staff cannot serve them quickly enough.

u8MVLlQHRxmvK95qNzf9pw.text: Fresh and diversify food. Very good to eat before a long work day or simply breakfast. Low price. Orangejuice is making with a veritable fruits !

CzQ5QHWgbsz43ZwM45NeKg.text: Pret, has some of the best sandwiches out of all the chain sandwich shops. This is because they use decent and high quality food in their sandwiches and are made on premises, meaning they are fresh. They also do good soup and coffee to go with your sandwich.Though Pret can be a bit of the dear side in terms of pricing, it is pretty much worth it, as you know you are getting quality.

zUuk_FDB4Wj4QLUj6iGYow.text: Best Pret in London (although i've only been into four!!) Great staff and obviously located ten seconds from my office!! Always a winner there!

F0ysRIjs6DKqp_G16PpQ2g.text: I recommend pret-a-manger for vegetarians and non vegetarians,their range of sandwiches and food can be eaten by all class of people because they are made naturally,when it comes to price they might be a bit expensive but its worth it.

MS6xMNsnzQwUgIDGOQuBfw.text: Pret a Manger is great coffee chain that has some really affordable prices. Their sandwiches are great and they are made of lots of fresh ingredients. There are sandwiches for all people, from all walks of life. Including sandwiches for vegetarians specifically. This branch isn't very packed as there are a few near by in more densely crowded areas. ALSO the staff here is friendly and helpful. I admit that their food is a bit more expensive than other similar sandwich chains but it is also of much higher quality and for a few extra pennies you do get much higher quality food. Overall: A great store, if the prices were cheaper I would have rated it a 5-star.

6YsM4HO8tBZaUlTlxScZ6A.text: My favourite chain for lunch on the go; probably does not need reviewing, but just in case. Pret have the most consistent quality of fresh ingredients, and some nice little innovative products like their no-bread sandwiches and the single pret (for those who only want half a sandwich). My personal favourite is the crayfish salad. Been hooked for many years.

8Ht6I48RIvdEXksvt4yj1w.text: I love Pret, their sandwiches are always delicious and adventerous, I always find it so hard to choose as everything always looks so fresh and tempting. They now do hot tortilla wraps which are really geat and their homemade soup and miso soup are great to warm you up on a cold winters day! The best place to go if you are on the run.

rjyIfnHoWtZnVeWNpI79yg.text: I know Pret is a chain, but is there anything really wrong with chains, as long as they're good? Pret is definitely good - the sandwiches are really fresh and made with good quality, organic ingredients. The coffee is good - definitely better than Starbucks, and the place is clean and spacious. Definitely a good option for lunch in the holborn/temple area.

a7FNd6z-z4LkrjP6PrrMcg.text: As with all Pret stores you know what you are going to get, good fresh food, cooked and made on the premises, coffee is good, especially if you like it strong. I love their pastries warm from the oven and the Super Club is not for the fainthearted. Piccadilly branch is quite large and busy but you never queue for long.

Nfky4DDCLo5os42ZaJYKvA.text: pret offers consistent quality for both drinks and food. i like the fact that there are long timer staff in this pret who now recognise me when i pop in. Behind the scenes the shops are run efficiently and they run nice staff motivation schemes. prefer their coffee over other similar chains

euIxWFQiOXJCyqPpFqlQPA.text: The food in Pret is always reliable, but that's what happen when you're part of a chain. It also means you can get bored of the choice quite quickly. But anyway, it is what it is, and there wouldnt be Pret on every street corner if they werent doing something right. I sometimes find the service in this branch quite slow, but it's not the end of the world.

YbEs6YJF0FcRpKtK3pAMxw.text: I'm not sure which Pret I went into because they are literally in every street corner in London (I think it was this location, though not 100% sure), but it doesn't matter. I love every Pret. I had a wonderful bean soup and brownie as a quick lunch. No mess, no fuss. Cheap by London standards. This place is like a Starbucks back home, except better (and specializing in sandwiches rather than coffee). They have cute messages in their napkins and products (very much like Chipotle). Pret also has a location in Heathrow. Bought myself a carrot cake for my almost nine hour flight home. I'm waiting for them to come to Miami.

R6ROA0yqdwj21tmHkd9TQw.text: Good place to grab a quick hot and tasty breakfast. Organic coffee is a plus. Bakery is well stocked. Service is friendly and quick. This location is open before most breakfast places a good way to get a head start on your day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom

HBpBWlj1-7gJ-yQB6qQQeQ.text: I rarely like big chains cafe but this one got me. I love their yogurts, vegan coconut yogurt, acai bowl and their melted dried tomato and mozzarella pastry. Coffee shop is fairly good too. Anyway, its the perfect cafe if you're looking for something to go or even to sit and they lots of healthy options.

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom

qWo6mrauGaiFJbmS8x_jaQ.text: I love soups and these ones don't seem fresh. They are too indian or asian. I would love a normal pumpkin soup, or something light. Tomato one seems like a sauce...hard to digest. Doesn't seem freshly made. Is it canned? What's the point?People are very rude. Customers don't respect other people's individual tables and seem to run and compete no matter what. It's not the idea for this place. Some salespeople are rude and careless. I wish they offered fresh fruit juices instead of coffee that doesn't benefit cranky people. They have bottled juices that are not freshly made. No vegan options. They say veggies, which can be misleading.

QIRXpK42f1WjizFKpmvBpg.text: 2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 239/365Pret A Manger IS AWESOMEEEE! My dad and I were staying at a hotel down the street, and were looking for a cheap, easy place to go to for breakfast during our 5-day stay in London. There were a ton of bakeries and cafes along Piccadilly Circus, but we decided to go to Pret A Manger since it looked pretty good. This was one of the best discoveries we found whilst in London! SO good that we went back EVERY single morning for breakfast while we were there!My dad and I had never heard of Pret A Manger before. It's pretty similar to Starbucks, except the selection of food is WAY BETTER! They had coolers and shelves all along one entire wall with different bottled juices, waters, beverages, pastries, sandwiches, soups, etc. Perfect for anybody who is on the go and wants a fresh, portable meal! We noticed a LOT of people stopped by Pret on their way to work, as many people were in business attire and looked like they wanted to get in and out as soon as possible. The Pret employees cater to their customers by working FAST! They all look like busy little worker ants trying to get everything done as quickly as possible which was great.The first time I went I ordered the pina colada smoothie which was unfortunately a major bust. Not good at all...blech. However, I started ordering the hot chocolate which was deeelicious. Better than the hot chocolate normally served at coffee shops in the US. My biggest and best discovery from Pret A Manager was their CHOCOLATE CROISSANTS! They are SO. GOOD. I normally don't like croissants in general, but there was something that I just LOVED about Pret's! I also got my dad hooked on them and he started ordering them everyday too! :P My dad's favorite item from Pret A Manger was their ham, cheese and tomato pastry. They were made fresh every morning and he LOVED them. This location was the first Pret A Manger we ever saw while in London, but we soon realized that it is a VERY popular chain in England, and saw them on almost every street corner. Even more popular than Starbucks which is saying something!If Pret existed in the US, my dad and I would probably be regulars. Amazing coffee shop with really good food! I highly recommend for anyone who wants a quick, easy, and cheap breakfast/brunch! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom

iXJQ-Bf9yoDgcw_w2dxSwA.text: I traveled last year here from LA, and can I just say it was the best place I went to during my trip. I traveled around Europe trying all type of food and please believe me when I say this spot is probably the only one that made an impact in my life. I wish they would bring these to the U.S but then again not, it's perfect far away. Again LOVE this place! Please go here if you're ever around. I love their wraps, soups and fresh squeezed juice. Oh and their chocolate croissant are to die for!

Ym2GXwvkENs8Vc0xWOoydg.text: I am generally not a fan of big chain cafes and grab and go places but Pret A Mangr changed that for me. I tried a handful of different sandwiches during my trip and all of them tasted great and fresh. My favorite was the chicken pesto sandwich. It is a great place for those touring around town to be able to go in and grab a good sandwich and continue on with your activities for the day. Highly recommend!

Ql8-oUgwGQfZGrROeirFGQ.text: Walked by and got a latte to go to split with the bestie. The line up was long, however, it moved at a decent pace. Fair prices and good customer service.

FqS988Vjyqaa8saxxJqqHQ.text: This was a great discovery in London this time. They have locations everywhere and the food is fresh, wholesome and delicious. Every sandwich and salad was luscious as were their fresh juices and smoothies. I was able to take my kid in and know that we could get her something healthy and filling. Green Park,Baker Street, Piccadilly, near the Tower of London, we even had our last meal at their terminal three location in Heathrow. Seating was a challenge at times as they have few tables in most locations. Phone charging outlets would be a great add on.

7s8_g5CdBGGMCZo5YmDJHw.text: Pret saved me when I was wandering around London. They have delicious, healthy food for take out! Like a Panera if everything was hot and ready to go.

F3_lfZ57rfUSyciGxS5KoA.text: Pret a Manager is everywhere in London! It is a very affordable and a good way to eat cheaply and the food is very good for what you pay. Keep in mind that prices are more expensive if you eat in. So grab it to go and head to St James, Kensington, or Hyde Park and enjoy.I personally recommend the duck and hoisson wrap and the Salmon and edamae cup.....wonderful.

79AxLbIQnaX2Yn7XRG4Q7w.text: Out of all the sandwich shops in London .. Pret for me has to be the best. Fresh ingredients ,tasty selections and such a great variety ... Whether it's a slice of paradise you're looking for or that yogurty creamy sensations Pret has it! I'm a fan .... You will be too! They even have bloody sushi guys!!!

XTYVc9wts_9XAhGwLmXHXA.text: Good and Healthy food and value for money. The only thing they lack is that they have no wifi for foreigners. But food is good and staff are helpful :)

pcj7Uk8XfGCY8y16QL7qUQ.text: Fresh sandwiches and fruit - I didn't plan on being healthy while in vacation but sign me up! I also love the trafalgar square location

flXtxTEM_r2xDuBmWgqX2Q.text: Fantastic stop for starving tourists looking to maximize their travel budgets. Saved the day for us and we enjoyed it. They are all over which is a great comfort, knowing we had easy access to good, inexpensive, healthy food.

rQ0Fx7Kxjj4PGvYbWP80nw.text: I love Pret! It's everywhere in London I wish we had some in California. I did see some when I visited Canada. But it's so cute and convenient and their food is always fresh. I had a seasonal turkey and cranberry sandwich while my friend had the duck wrap. My sandwich was really good and I would get it again if I have the chance. Overall Pret has some pretty health and good food when you're on the go and have to grab something quick!

Kjutvwsd8oOKkVw0kHnKOQ.text: Loved this place! We came to visit London for a week and saw this place everywhere! Perfect for trying to stay healthy while on holiday. It has a delicious range of healthy food including salads, sandwiches, sushi, fruit and other assorted items. Their hot drinks were perfect for the cold winter days and they even have hot soups and pastas to go. It's fairly affordable and was our "go to" place whenever we were hungry. I would highly recommend this franchise to anyone in London. I'm only sad that it doesn't yet exist here in New Zealand :(

uTzW1Ish5i37Q3VPbU1E2w.text: Pret is fantastic option for breakfast and lunch, always very fresh and delicious. I recently stayed in Mayfair and this was my closest Pret, easy walking distance to Green Park and the hotel that I was staying in.Nothing beats the fresh muesli and the chicken & avocado sandwich and mango smoothie.I wish Pret was a bit closer to me here in Australia!

koJSkzjKR6GRTANkFrMZLg.text: They are good. They are cheap and they are everywhere.Sad but one of the best things I had in London food wise was Pret's Pasta Salad.

VLqSt2nyssDSq4aryVogGQ.text: Although much copied, I still think Pret a Manger are leaders in what they do: a highly consistent chain of sandwich shops, selling generously-filled sandwiches with high quality, fresh and natural ingredients. (All sandwiches are made on the premises, fresh each day). There are good choices for vegetarians (I especially like their vegetable crisps, made from root vegetables others than spuds). They're a bit pricier than some other chains, but worth it in my view. This branch in Piccadilly is useful to know as it's not too rushed at lunchtimes, and is open seven days a week.
